txt.en: Return to Ephrâti the bookseller.\n\nEphrâti can be found in Tilmakhím in Takhdâr.
Ephrâti has asked you to deal with the rat menace.
Amarêkh has asked you to go north to a place called Tilmakhím, the Cross-roads. There the bookseller Ephrâti should have the book \qA Smouldering Fire\q for Amarêkh.

'I have the book, but I don't want your coin. All day long I deal with the rats.

'It's rats this, rats that. They get in the books, my hair, they get in everything. I've tried to make the best of it.

'Ephrâti, they said, just eat the rats. Make the best of a bad situation.

'Have you tried rat soup? I have, it's disgusting. Please just deal with the rats.'
Return to Amarêkh in Mekab-kuphâr with the book

'You've thinned their number? Excellent. Here is the book you requested.

'Maybe tonight I'll finally stop dreaming of a gallant rat prince to take me away to his rat kingdom, where all the houses are made of discarded grain and the carriages spin on wheels of ale cheese.'

She stops abruptly.

'Never mind. My dreams are my own business. Kindly take the book and be off with you.'
Return to Amarêkh in Mekab-kuphâr, in southern Khabârkhad, with the book.

'You found it! Oh, thank you!

'Now I don't have to be so dreadfully bored here.

'Ephrâti? Yeah, she can be a bit dramatic. And a terrible cook. Her rat soup is awful.'
Amarêkh has asked you to go north to Tilmakhím for a new book.

'It gets so boring down here. These other guards aren't the best conversationalists, you know. I wonder, would you be able to obtain a book for me?'

She leans in close, as though to tell you a secret.

'There's a specific one I'm after. \qA Smouldering Fire.\q It's very... academic.

'There's a bookseller to the north, just outside Khabârkhad in an area called Tilmakhím, the Cross-roads.

'Here, take a few coins for the bookseller. Would you be able to get this book for me?'
Talk to the bookseller Ephrâti in Tilmakhím
